titles.title: Downed Animal Protection Act of 1993
A bill to amend the Packers and Stockyards Act, 1921, to make it unlawful for any stockyard owner, market agency, or dealer to transfer or market nonambulatory livestock, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1603-1604)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Agricultural Research.

committee.name: Senate Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.subcommittee: Agricultural Research, Conservation, Forestry and General Legislation

bill.summary: 2/16/1993--Introduced. Downed Animal Protection Act - Amends the Packers and Stockyards Act, 1921 to make it unlawful for any stockyard owner, market agency, or dealer to market, transfer, or hold nonambulatory livestock that has not been humanely euthanized.
